title: Line Chart
description: A line chart which can show multiple datasets as coloured lines. This chart is suitable for large datasets.

title.title: Chart ID
title.description: Identifies the chart in the document. Cannot contain spaces or special characters. Example: Chart description - 'Funding by area'; Chart ID - 'funding-area'

desc.title: Description
desc.description: Chart description (caption) explaining what the chart is showing. Will display as a heading before the chart graphic.

chartHeight.title: Chart height
chartHeight.description: Height of the chart as percentage of its width (i.e. 120 will make the chart taller than it's wide)

range.title: Data range
range.description: [optional] the maximum value shown by the gridlines of the chart. Defaults to the maximum value in the dataset.

gridLinesCount.title: Number of gridlines
gridLinesCount.description: Number of horizontal grid lines with matching y-axis labels.

fontSize.title: Labels font size
fontSize.description: Affects all labels including the axis labels.

categories.title: Categories list
categories.description: This should be of the same length as the value array in each dataset

items.title: Category label
items.description: (some of these may be automatically omitted in large datasets to make more space)

style.title: Style options
style.description: These options set label positioning and style.

title.title: Title style
title.description: Bubble draws a circle under the label, plain draws just the label.

number.title: Number style
number.description: Inside draws the label on top of the line, Outside draws it above the line.

value.title: Chart data
value.description: A list of datasets, each containing a list of values of the same length

items.title: Dataset
items.description: A set of data developing over the specified categories (e.g. points in time)

value.title: Values
value.description: A list of values in the dataset

items.title: Value
items.description: Numerical value for the corresponding category

prefix.title: Prefix
prefix.description: The text to put in front of the values, e.g. currency sign.

suffix.title: Suffix
suffix.description: The text to put after the values, e.g. units or % sign

legend.title: Legend [optional]
legend.description: The legend (key) of the chart. Will show under the chart normally, and next to it in expanded mode. Some charts will generate their keys automatically, this allows us to override them.
